item.title: What is Elm?
item.description: A delightful language for reliable webapps. Elm is a domain-specific programming language for creating web browser-based graphical user interfaces. It's main features are: Immutability Static types Module system Interoperability with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript It's main advantages are: No runtime exceptions Great performance Small assets The main advantage for a developer is that when the Elm compiler is happy with the code, browsers and users will be happy too (the same feeling Go developers have).

item.title: Welcome to Go
item.description: Golang as common language In January 2020 I took the chance to present my talk “Welcome to Go” about the Go Programming Language at Guild42.ch. Guild42.ch is an association that organizes events on topics related to software development in Berne, Switzerland. Over 85 developers from around Berne were interested in the topic. Until there I was telling only Swiss Post stuff about Golang and argued about why the language is very useful.
